intro: Cephalophora radiata, commonly known as the radiate headplant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and its striking, radially symmetrical flowers. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to arid environments. Cephalophora radiata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
